section.para: The Cheque Services function is used to manage cheques issued against accounts the user has authority over, that are maintained by the Bank.

section.title: Cheque Services - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Cheque Services function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Cheque Services.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, there may be a link to the Cheque Services function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Cheque Services - Options
section.para: The Cheque Services function allows access to the Fund Transfer module provided by Cash Portal. In the left side navigation menu, a number of options are provided for Cheque Services.
The following options are available for Cheque Services:

listitem.para: Set of functions for creating a request to initiate a product, and submitting the request to the bank.
Set of functions for creating a request to amend a product, and submitting the request to the bank.
Set of functions for creating a free-format message regarding a product, and submitting the message to the bank. In some modules this is called Update.
Review, complete and submit Cheque Services records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit Cheque Services records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Cheque Services - Cashier Order/Cheque Status Inquiry
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Cheque Services page, it allows the user to inquire on cheques and Cashier Orders issued against accounts they have authority to use.

A number of search fields can be completed to limit the search for the required information. The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The details required are:

Field
Type
Description
Entity
Enter the Entity that raised the Cheque or Cashier Order. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Bank
The bank holding the requested account.
If you are linked to more than one bank, the Bank dropdown is available. If you are linked to only one bank, this field doesnâ€™t appear.
Account Number
Enter the account number that Cheque or Cashier Order is to be drawn from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.
Cheque Type
Select whether the inquiry is for a Cheque or Cashier Order, from the dropdown menu.
Cheque Number (From: - To:)
Select Cheque number From and To range, to display.
When all fields have been completed, click the Ok button to display the status of Cheques and Cashier Orders that match the search criteria..

section.title: Cheque Services - Stop Cashier Order/Cheque Request
section.para: This option, when selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Cheque Services page, allows Cheques and Cashier Orders to be stopped.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu, the details of the default Bank are displayed. In addition, search criteria can be specified to narrow the search for the payment that is to be stopped.
The form details required are:

Field
Type
Description
Entity
Enter the Entity that raised the Cheque or Cashier Order. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Bank
The bank holding the requested account.
If you are linked to more than one bank, the Bank dropdown is available. If you are linked to only one bank, this field doesnâ€™t appear.
Account Number
Enter the account number that Cheque or Cashier Order is to be drawn from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.
Cheque Type
Select whether the inquiry is for a Cheque or Cashier Order, from the dropdown menu.
Cheque Number (From: - To:)
Select Cheque number From and To range, to display.
When all fields have been completed, click the Submit button to request the matching payments be stopped.

section.title: Cheque Services - Cheque Book Request
section.para: This option, when selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Cheque Services page, allows new Cheque books to be ordered for a user's account.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu, the details of the default Bank are displayed. In addition, account details can be specified to identify the account the cheque books are required for.
The form details required are:

Field
Type
Description
Entity
Enter the Entity that raised the Cheque or Cashier Order. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Bank
The bank holding the requested account.
If you are linked to more than one bank, the Bank dropdown is available. If you are linked to only one bank, this field doesnâ€™t appear.
Account Number
Enter the account number that Cheque or Cashier Order is to be drawn from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.
Number Required
Enter the number of cheque books required.
Delivery Mode
Select from the dropdown list, the method of delivery. The options are:Normal Mail Registered Mail
When all fields have been completed, click the Submit button to request the Cheque books be supplied. Note that cheque books will not be delivered until the bank has approved this request.

section.title: Cheque Services - Edit Transactions
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the of the Cash services > Cheque Services page > Cheque Services page, it allows a Cheque Services request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When selected, this option will present a list of Cheque Services requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

section.title: Cheque Services - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Cheque Services page, it allows a Cheque Services requests that a user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

When selected, this option will present a list of Cheque Services requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.
Click on the entry in the System ID column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.
